properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 6 at 11:24AM CST until February 7 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Nashville TN
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the
following rivers in Middle Tennessee...

Harpeth River At Bellevue affecting Davidson and Williamson Counties

. Heavy rains have caused the Harpeth River at Bellevue to rise above Action
Stage. The river is expected to crest overnight and recede on Friday.

The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a
* Flood Advisory for
The Harpeth River At Bellevue
* At 10AM Thursday the stage was 14.0 feet.
* Action stage is 14.0 feet.
* Flood stage is 20.0 feet.
* The river will rise to near 15.6 feet after midnight tonight.
* At 16.0 feet...Portions of the Harpeth River Greenway may be covered with
water and impassable, and the access road and the parking lot to the Harpeth
River State Park are completely inundated.
* At 14.0 feet...Portions of the Harpeth River Greenway begin to be inundated,
and water begins to inundate the parking lot of the Harpeth River State Park
at Highway 100.
properties.instruction:
Stay tuned to NOAA weather radio or other local media for further information
from the National Weather Service.
